subject: PE Today: Watergate Turns 35
body:
CBSNews.com













Watergate 
      NowWith this weekend 
      marking the 35th anniversary of the Watergate burglary, the normal 
      round of conjecture has returned asking, "Could reporters break 
      the story in today's media culture?"  Public Eye's Matthew 
      Felling takes a look at the landscape and says that it could not be 
      replicated for four major reasons.
[+ Read More]



History's 
      1st Draft in the Classroom?NBC News has announced a 
      new online 
      venture (iCue) 
      to supplement America’s high school history, politics and English 
      curricula with NBC News footage. While NBC 
      might see it selfishly as a promotional opportunity, an 
      unintended benefit of I-Cue may be a positive bump in how America’s youth 
      sees mainstream media.[+ Read More]



From 
      the CBS Vault: UFOsIn this week's edition of 
      "From The Vault," CBS Reports (and IBM!) investigates the question, "UFO: 
      Friend, Foe Or Fantasy?" Walter 
      Cronkite is your host, and the original air date is May 10, 1966. 
[+ Read More]
